metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: HTML contains several elements for defining user input and computer code.
content.html: HTML contains several elements for defining user input and computer code.

content.code_html:
<code>
x = 5;
y = 6;
z = x + y;
</code>

content.text: The HTML <kbd> element is used to define keyboard input. The content inside is displayed in the browser's default monospace font.
content.html: The HTML <kbd> element is used to define keyboard input. The content inside is displayed in the browser's default monospace font.

content.code_html: <p>Save the document by pressing <kbd>Ctrl + S</kbd></p>

content.text: The HTML <samp> element is used to define sample output from a computer program. The content inside is displayed in the browser's default monospace font.
content.html: The HTML <samp> element is used to define sample output from a computer program. The content inside is displayed in the browser's default monospace font.

content.code:
Message from my computer:

File not found.
Press F1 to continue
content.code_html:
<p>Message from my computer:</p>
<p><samp>File not found.<br>Press F1 to continue</samp></p>

content.text: The HTML <code> element is used to define a piece of computer code. The content inside is displayed in the browser's default monospace font.
content.html: The HTML <code> element  is used to define a piece of computer code. The content inside is displayed in the browser's default monospace font.

content.code_html:
<code>
x = 5;
y = 6;
z = x + y;
</code>

content.text: Notice that the <code> element does NOT preserve extra whitespace and line-breaks.
content.html: Notice that the <code> element does NOT preserve extra whitespace and line-breaks.

content.text: To preserve extra whitespace and line-breaks, you can put the <code> element inside a <pre> element:
content.html: To preserve extra whitespace and line-breaks, you can put the <code> element inside a <pre> element:

content.code_html:
<pre>
<code>
x = 5;
y = 6;
z = x + y;
</code>
</pre>

content.text: The HTML <var> element is used to define a variable in programming or in a mathematical expression. The content inside is typically displayed in italic.
content.html: The HTML <var> element  is used to define a variable in programming or in a mathematical expression. The content inside is typically displayed in italic.

content.code: The area of a triangle is: 1/2 x b x h, where b is the base, andh is the vertical height.
content.code_html: <p>The area of a triangle is: 1/2 x <var>b</var> x <var>h</var>, where <var>b</var> is the base, and <var>h</var> is the vertical height.</p>

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
Which one of the following is NOT an HTML element?
content.html: Which one of the following is NOT an HTML element?

metadata.question: Which one of the following is NOT an HTML element?

content.question: Which one of the following is NOT an HTML element?

content.code_html:
Tag Description
<code> Defines programming code
<kbd> Defines keyboard input 
<samp> Defines computer output
<var> Defines a variable
<pre> Defines preformatted text

content.text: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference .
content.html: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference.
